resources.string: Using sensors to record wave data.

Press Record to get real time wave measurements! By following the NDBC\'s general approach to wave measurements and using Android sensors like the accelerometer and gyroscope, you can estimate wave height, wave period, and wave direction.
Using location to get waves data.

Entering in a zip code will allow the application to retrieve the zip codes longitude and latitude coordinates. Those coordinates are then used to get wave data from Marine API. Hourly data from the past 24 hours including wave height, wave period, and wave direction is returned.
Please enter a valid 5 digit zip code
" Wave height is determined by estimating the vertical displacement of the phone using the accelerometerâ€™s Z-axis data. This involves double integrating the vertical acceleration over time."
" Wave period is computed by analyzing the frequency content of the vertical acceleration data. Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) is used to convert the time domain signal into its frequency components."

The wave direction is derived from horizontal acceleration data combined with gyroscope and magnetometer readings. This method blends FFT-based phase difference from horizontal acceleration with a complementary filter that fuses gyroscope and sensor (magnetometer) data.
